user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_linux_dev_dma_unmap:
```c
static void metal_linux_dev_dma_unmap(struct metal_bus *bus,
				      struct metal_device *device,
				      uint32_t dir,
				      struct metal_sg *sg,
				      int nents)
{
	struct linux_device *ldev = to_linux_device(device);
	struct linux_bus *lbus = to_linux_bus(bus);

	ldev->ldrv->dev_dma_unmap(lbus, ldev, dir, sg,
				       nents);
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function metal_linux_dev_dma_unmap:
static struct linux_device *to_linux_device(struct metal_device *device)
{
	return metal_container_of(device, struct linux_device, device);
}
...
static struct linux_bus *to_linux_bus(struct metal_bus *bus)
{
	return metal_container_of(bus, struct linux_bus, bus);
}
...
struct linux_bus {
	struct metal_bus	bus;
	const char		*bus_name;
	struct linux_driver	drivers[MAX_DRIVERS];
	struct sysfs_bus	*sbus;
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I found no code fragments in the provided snippets that are syntactically or semantically unreachable. The function metal_linux_dev_dma_unmap contains a straight-line sequence of statements (local pointer initializations followed by a single function-pointer invocation) with no conditional compilation, unconditional goto, return before the end, infinite loop, or any code after a return/exit that would be impossible to reach. The helper functions to_linux_device and to_linux_bus are simple container_of wrappers that return pointers (no unreachable code inside). The struct linux_bus is a data declaration (no executable statements) and therefore cannot contain unreachable executable code. There are no switch statements, multiple case labels, fall-through branches, dead branches, or other constructs in the supplied fragments that could produce unreachable code per MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1. Consequently, nothing in the provided code needs further investigation for unreachable-code concerns.
